ProblemDomain

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProblemDomain.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1 Player class which holds information about the current player and it's opponent. This class holds the global grid which has the coordinates that relate to this users game board. Fleet is a collection of ships so it is easy to collect and transfer.
    Author:
    Matt Jones

      • Player

        public Player(boolean isPlayer,
              java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> globalGridPlayer,
              GameController gameController)
        Parameters:
        isPlayer - is this our player or opponent
        globalGridPlayer - coordinate grid that relates to game board
        gameController - controller that handles gameplay

    • Method Detail

      • addShip

        public void addShip(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> coordinates,
                    Ship.ShipType shipType)
        This add ship function is important to adding ships from the coordinates the users is clicking on at the moment. Also determines the ship type of the ship. When all 5 are built, they are sent to the server to be sent to opponent.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - where the user is clicking / relate to grid
        shipType - type of ship being built

      • getCoordinateFromLists

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getCoordinateFromLists(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> input,
                                                              java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> globalList)
        Gets input coordinates from the users pointer, to match with the global grid coordinates
        Parameters:
        input - user clicked coordinates
        globalList - this players global grid
        Returns:
        coordinates matching

      • populateOpponentBoard

        private void populateOpponentBoard()
        populate the opponents board so that when a user clicks i know if it's a hit or not. Doesn't show anything on gui
